alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 3:55PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Moffat and northwestern Rio Blanco Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 354 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Dinosaur, or 40 miles southeast of Vernal, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Moffat and northwestern Rio Blanco Counties, including the following locations... Massadona and Blue Mountain. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 4 and 29. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 34. Colorado 139 between mile markers 71 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus
